review_title: A college/company that you want to work with until you retire!
pros: ACC has a culture of respecting students and Associates (employees) in a way that is unsurpassed in the proprietary education industry. This care for others has improved our student success and the natural outcome has become our retention, licensing and placement rates consistently exceed our accreditation standards.
cons: Due to our belief and buy-in to a deliberately developmental organization and continuous improvement, we continue to relentlessly search for additional mvp team members every opportunity that we have to fill faculty and administrative roles, which is exciting as we build our bench to support our increasing student population and program options for day, evening, and weekend programs. This is not a con, but we can never be "too good" or "too prepared" for our students who deserve the best support possible in their quest to improve their lives through careers and positive community impact.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Los Angeles, CA
pros: ACC has great benefits, fun team building events and some great colleagues. It's definitely competitive work environment, but ACC strives to be the best. I know my job and push myself to be my best, so if you are trusted as a loyal and valued employee, this works. Keep an open and honest dialog with management to things that need to be addressed to try and affect change.
cons: Switch out those large speed bumps in the parking lot.

job_title: Program Director in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The strengths include the culture and focus on student outcomes. The college has won many community service awards, with placement rates. It feels good to help students succeed. There is a lot of focus on development with training, and management does an excellent job of listening. The benefits are the best, with vacation payout, emergency funds, health, and dental, etc.
cons: I know there is work being done to bring all of the IT systems together, as there is a lot of manual work.

review_title: Unhealthy work environment & not student focused
job_title: Nursing Faculty in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Pay, and occasional raffles to win prizes, swag.
cons: Faculty turnover, students not getting adequate clinical experience, students being ignored, inconsistent application of policies both for students & employees. If you look up ACC on Yelp notice NO praise for the RN program, only the LVN program-there is a reason!! Lack of orientation & training or support to employees. If you are not a "Yes" person, you will not thrive here. If you have no problem with bending your ethics and being sabotaged, join the team!

pros: 1.) Dedication to student outcomes and success. 2.) Amazing company culture; staff feel free to provide input and feel they are heard. 3.) Long history of success.
cons: None to be noted at this time.

job_title: Lead MBC Instructor in Long Beach, CA
pros: Had wonderful support from Directors and Managers
cons: Too far to commute for me

review_title: It is a learning experience in itself
pros: Very small campus, overall friendly staff
cons: Micromanaging staff too focused on ATI vs educating

job_title: Call Center Representative in Irvine, CA
pros: Great work atmosphere and great coworkers
cons: Very low pay for the experience requested for the job in ther first place

review_title: Very rewarding work but can improve the environment
pros: This is a non-profit that exists to help people finish their high school equivalency. You will work with and impact the lives of many people who never finished high school. Seeing their joy once they are complete is feeling like no other. You will be making a difference in someone’s life.
cons: There environment amongst administration is not very collegial. Administration does not take the time to build relationships with you or foster an environment for collaboration amongst colleagues.

review_title: Great place to work, needs to raise pay
job_title: Call Center Representative in Irvine, CA
pros: Great work environment within the call center.
cons: Lack of pay and advancement.

review_title: Good Place to Work, Scheduleing is difficult
job_title: LVN Instructor in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Working autonomously.
Coworkers (other instructors ect) are wonderful.
cons: Some upper managment could use a spa day or something. They're very stressed and take it out on those under them. But they're easy to avoid when you're not working on campus (working at a clinical site)

pros: Typical corporate benefits-PTOs, and stuff
cons: Typical corporate cons- corporate being a corporate you know of…

job_title: Career Services Advisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Everyone in the department was hardworking and dedicated when it came to assisting the students. I enjoyed my co-workers, hours and pay were decent.
rewarding job.
cons: The director was difficult. It was like you had to go through a hazing of sorts to prove yourself. I was told everyone goes through that.

pros: I appreciate the safe and positive environment ACC in Anaheim is. I enjoy working with my team and helping our students. Everyone there is on a mission to make ACC the best place where students can flourish and grow in their education and careers.
cons:
fast pace and 
too quick

job_title: Regional Director of Business Development in Anaheim, CA
pros: I make a difference every day by influencing and changing the lives of our students and graduates. Every person within our organization cares about our outcomes. This is not just a job, it's a calling. I also love the focus on promoting a growth mindset. When the pandemic hit, we were ready to change gears immediately.
cons: Our students have been impacted by so many external challenges during the last year. Clinical rotations and experiences continue to be challenging.

pros: I love making a difference in the lives of our students and graduates. Our success is measured literally in lives that are changed. Leadership and staff members demonstrate passion and a caring attitude. Every problem can be solved.
cons: The last year has been difficult on students due to the difficulty of accessing clinical rotations.

review_title: ACC is the Best Company to be a part of
job_title: Admissions Team Lead in Ontario, CA
pros:
Just an amazing place to work we are family! 
ACC is about ensuring our students get the best training & help they need to reach their goals. Our campus is beautiful inside and out!
cons: I don’t have any cons, I am truly al blessed to work for ACC & anyone lucky enough to be part of ACC can attest to that.

pros: ACC lives by their values and is focused on student success. The associates all work toward the same goals based on helping students and do whatever they can to help them achieve their goals. ACC also takes care of their associates and has great benefits and work environment.
cons: I cannot think of any at this time.

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Room for learning and growing
cons: fast pace and stressful at times.

job_title: Senior Admisions Representative in Ontario, CA
pros: Fun place to work. All staff members are passionate and caring for others.
cons: No Cons. ACC is transparent and sets us up to understand our roles.

job_title: Distance Education Specialist in Anaheim, CA
pros: Great leadership and terrific camaraderie!
cons: I cannot think of one.

job_title: Adjunct Clinical Instructor in Anaheim, CA
pros: ACC has an amazing work team
cons: Pay is lower than WCU

job_title: Retired I T Director in Los Angeles, CA
pros: For-profit schools get a bad rap, but this school follows the rules
cons: It's always a scramble to rank in the top tier

review_title: Great benefits poor  with micro Management
job_title: ST Instructor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great benefits and some great co workers
cons: Micro Management, minimal growth opportunities. Drama with team members at times

review_title: Administration still totally out of touch
pros: Warm fuzzy feelings when a student actually makes it.
cons: Too many students get nothing but a large debt. There is a huge push to recruit students, not so much to place them. Admissions still just push them into any program and don't really assess the individual's capabilities. The instructors work their butts off to get the student to the finish line even when it is clear that the student is not hireable (because the numbers must be met, not the actual student needs). The organization spends a LOT of money on buildings and looking great and should invest in the teachers.

pros: Able to work any day of the week as clinical, theory, or skills lab instructor.
cons: This place doesn’t function as a school, it functions as a business. It has an excellent marketing department advertising hand on and small classes. In reality the classes are around 60 students, the clinical groups up to 15, the skills lab outdated, and the clinical sites a mess. The administration is a chaos they lose emails and documents constantly, they do not support instructors. Many occasions they don’t even know what’s going on; they request constantly documents from prior months, double book instructors, provide information for a rotation on the last minute and so on. This institution has the same problems over and over and over. Students become disappointed, frustrated, anger and rebellious. The pay is average, no raise, no benefits, no future. Finally, the administration doesn't accept criticism; if they hear something they don’t like they shot you down.

pros: company provided challenging work which will keep you busy
cons: The tuition re-imbursement plan is a joke.  Middle mgmt. doesn't know what they are doing and there is a lot of favoritism. The dept is so busy you don't have time to take breaks. Had to walk in the rain and heat to 3 bldgs so I can talk to students in the hallway about personal issues. I was compared to other campus counter parts who had 1/3 of my responsabilities.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Lynwood, CA
pros: I would say that working with ACC for four years, I see this company as the best catalyst for change -  better perspectives, innovation in education and  promotes civility between and among employees and students.
cons: I have none as of this time, the company is always aiming to further opportunities of learning and growth personally and professionally of the employees.

pros: Nice office building in Irvine and campuses are well laid out. Some program directors care about diversity and safety.  Campus offers free clinics to low income communities. Good career growth for employees who are paid on the low end to move up to "director" level. Easy to move up since there is high turnover and layoffs once a year.
cons: Management practices are unfair. HR changes are not announced. Policies are unclear and vague. Hire family and friends who do not qualify - politically charged. Company avoids paying overtime by putting employees in exempt positions. Lack of professional development. Employees are not recognized for contribution except for the few "chosen ones."

pros: American Career College cares about their students and associates. Their reputation in the industry is one of excellence. If you care about others, this is a great place to work. It is very rewarding to impact the lives of others in a positive way.
cons: Like any rewarding work there is pressure to excel, long hours, and commitment required. There are many unique personalities and it is imperative to understand how to communicate with all types of people.

pros: Great staff, camaraderie , interaction with students.
cons: Run for your life if you're going for a position in Admissions. The Directors pick and choose who will make a successful advisor and who will struggle. The management treats admissions like machines who are not allowed to talk to their co-workers and pretty much either help a student in the office or like they say " smile and dial" or pound the phones. taking time off or calling in sick is taboo. This is one of the worst places I have ever worked. Management have no education and lack professionalism , its all about numbers. Lots of favoritism and office politics. Very toxic environment unless you're on the Boss's good side

job_title: Admissions Support Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The students learned from some of the best professionals instructors in the field, and learned hands on using the most up to date technology in the labs. This made me feel happy to show off to potential students.  The work environment was enjoyable, professional and rewarding.  I must say that i have learned many hard and soft skills.
cons: It would have been nice if there were more growth opportunity, for example a management  training program for employees.

review_title: Run....run as fast as you can.
pros: Students.  It should be about the students but it isn't.  This is a vocational school where how we get paid is with students enrolled.
cons: Everything else. Management is horrible. If you don't kiss  butt you will get fired.  Students pass classes and go to extern and have no clue what to do. They are unprepared. This school will keep a student at all cost. If you don't like to kiss upper managements butt and won't do unethical things then this is not the place for you. RUN

review_title: I love teaching,  it's very rewarding
job_title: Medical Assistant Instructor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Making a difference in the lives of young adults that have chosen to work in health care. Work with some dedicated individuals.
cons: Low pay and management takes your lunch breaks away when they want to... They also don't apply and follow their own policies.

pros:
-Beautiful workplace with great amenities 
-Work/life balance can be awesome depending on department you work
-Pay is solid 
-Select managers are excellent to work with
cons:
-Not much room for growth or long-term career
-Turnover rate is very high
-Some managers can be difficult to work with

job_title: Talent Acquisition Assistant in Irvine, CA
pros: Beautiful place to work great co workers. Great benefits and pension options. Working for ACC gave me a lot flexibility with my schedule.
cons: Poor management and lots of employee turn over. I believe the reason the company has POOR retention is due to management and lack of good leadership.

pros: Always on top of supplies, co-workers are friendly and management is efficient.
cons: The corporate office is run by imbeciles who looks at profit margins and not the welfare of students and instructors.

pros: Your voice matters, numbers aren't everything, but compliance is #1, students are our best reflection of what we do here. Great resources for students struggling and facing hardship through school. Great faculty support and benefits. Promoting from within is common.
cons: I honestly cannot think of any.

pros: beautiful campus, locations are up to par, they don't skimp on the façade of their buildings
cons: unprofessional low-end weak leadership. Still a mom and pop school. In dire need of positive leadership, they only point out all the negatives and have no contingency plan to assist in the growth and development of their talented people or in retaining current talent.

pros: Passionate, dedicated, committed, ever learning individuals work here and many have for a very long time.  Culture is upbeat, supportive and fun.   Students are the #1 priority. Hard to think folks would want to work anywhere else.
cons: Staffing levels require everyone to do their jobs.

job_title: Admissions Advisor/Re-entry Specialist in Anaheim, CA
pros: Good training and time to get better, somewhat good benefits and room to grow within organization.
cons: My position was an inside sales position and there was a sense of pressure for numbers and enrollments. Management at certain locations is very ineffective and there is a lot of turnover.

pros:
- People are nice 
- Great breakroom
- Clean facilities
cons:
- Monotonous job 
- Average 9-5 type of jobs where you sit at your desk all day 
- No sense of community culture within the company

review_title: Career Service Specialist for Surgery Technology
job_title: Career Service Specialist in Ontario, CA
pros: I get the opportunity to assist graduate with the first jobs on the path to their great futures.
cons: The programs are great here and there is a high gradutate percentage and i must proceed forward with the placement in the field of surgery.

pros: Supportive campus environment that supports student success.  Caring faculty that go above and beyond for their students.  Beautiful facilities and up to date equipment.  Team oriented culture.  Job placement is outstanding for graduates.
cons: Too many systems to track information.

pros: Company mission state is great if it is followed by all. Everyone was always very nice and pleasant.
cons: There seemed to be a lack of encouragement to employees, but this could have been in only the department I was located in.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: ACC really takes care of their employees. The more time that you commit to the company the better you are taken care. This is big plus if you are looking for long term employment.
cons: The distance from home, but worth the commute.

pros: The people and the culture. I absolutely love working here and feel phenomenal coming to work every day!
cons: I really can't think of anything except there is just not enough time in the day to get everything done!

job_title: Senior Admissions Advisor in Anaheim, CA
pros: Amazing school to work for. Everyone has the same vision for our students. Our work environment is great. Also room for growth!
cons: Everything is amazing. I have nothing but a great experience so far.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician Instructor in Anaheim, CA
pros: Great School with good benefits for full time employees.
cons: Good School but no benefits for part time employees.

job_title: Dental Assisting Instructor in Long Beach, CA
pros: Great working environment, Upper management is great
cons: Need to update curriculum more often to keep it fresh and relevant

pros: Culture based on student success
cons: Non-factual external political public perceptions

pros: Great company to work for. ACC take's care of there employee's.
cons: There is nothing negative about this company.

pros: Lots of staff with years of experience around. The employees in the department created a helpful team environment.
cons: No room for growth laterally.

pros: Annual reviews & quarterly award recognition.
cons: Micro managers, no autonomy, phone calls are recorded.

pros: There is a lot of growth in this company
cons: There are very long hours

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Long Beach, CA
